snippet.description: Temporomandibular Joint Syndrome: eMedicine Emergency Medicine Overview: TMJ, or temporal mandibular joint, is the synovial joint that connects the jaw to the skull. These two joints are located just in front of each ear. Each joint is composed of the condyle of the ...

snippet.title: Sternoclavicular Joint Injury: eMedicine Emergency Medicine
snippet.description: Sternoclavicular Joint Injury: eMedicine Emergency Medicine A freely moveable synovial joint links the upper extremity to the torso, with the sternoclavicular joint (SCJ) participating in all movements of the upper extremity. The SCJ is a saddle-type joint that provides free movement of ...

snippet.title: Rheumatoid Arthritis, Hands: eMedicine Radiology
snippet.description: Rheumatoid Arthritis, Hands: eMedicine Radiology Overview: Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) is a systemic inflammatory disease that results in cartilage and bone destruction. snippet.title: Synovial Chondromatosis: eMedicine Orthopedic Surgery
snippet.description: Synovial Chondromatosis: eMedicine Orthopedic Surgery Overview: History of the Procedure The pain, swelling, and mechanical symptoms of synovial chondromatosis and its generation of loose bodies have historically been treated with surgery. snippet.title: Synovial Cell Sarcoma: eMedicine Orthopedic Surgery
snippet.description: Synovial Cell Sarcoma: eMedicine Orthopedic Surgery Overview: Synovial cell sarcoma is one of the most common soft tissue tumors in adolescents and young patients, with approximately 1 in 3 cases occurring in the first 2 decades of life. Mean age of patients at diagnosis ...

snippet.title: RheumatologyLinx
snippet.description: RheumatologyLinx A free and easy tool to keep Rheumatologists and other clinicians up-to-date. Aggregates the most current professional news and research from premier medical and healthcare journals and news sources. Comprehensive, specialized content updated every business day on the web and in email newsletters.

snippet.title: Synovial Osteochondromatosis: eMedicine Radiology
snippet.description: Synovial Osteochondromatosis: eMedicine Radiology Overview: Synovial osteochondromatosis (SOC) is a benign condition characterized by synovial membrane proliferation and metaplasia. The entity also is termed synovial chondromatosis. The synovial lining of a joint, bursa, or tendon sheath undergoes nodular proliferation, and fragments ...
